Package com.cratediggers.service

Class ArtistServices

java.lang.Object
com.cratediggers.service.ArtistServices
public class ArtistServices
extends java.lang.Object
Handles all business logic for the artist module. Follows model-view-controller design architecture by ensuring that the model and view never interact directly.

    ArtistDAO object used to interact with the database (the model).

    private javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response

  • Constructor Details

    • ArtistServices

      public ArtistServices​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Constructs an ArtistServices object containing the request and response objects provided by a servlet. Constructs a new artistDAO object used to interact with the database (the model).
      Parameters:
      request - object that contains parameters received in HTTP request made to the server.
      response - object that is used to store attributes which are utilised for JSP generation.

  • Method Details

    • listArtist

      public void listArtist​(java.lang.String message) throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Retrieves a list of all artists from database. Forwards the list and a specified message onto "artist_list.jsp" to display to users.
      Parameters:
      message - to be displayed at top of JSP page
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • listArtist

      public void listArtist() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Provides polymorphism so that listArtist(String message) can be called without a specified message.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • createArtist

      public void createArtist() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Retrieves name and description parameters from request object and find the artist object with the given name. Checks if artist with given name already exists (name must be unique). If artist can be created then the ArtistDAO creates the record in the database (the model) and displays list of all artists in view. If not, generates and displays error message.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • editArtist

      public void editArtist() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Obtains artist object that corresponds to the id provided as a parameter in the request object. If artist exists then display "artist_form.jsp" in the view, setting the artist object as an attribute in the response object so that pre-existing artist object information can auto-fill in form fields. If artist does not exist then displays error message.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • updateArtist

      public void updateArtist() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Retrieves artistId, name and description parameters from request object. Finds the artist objects that currently contains the specified artistId and name. Checks if an artist object with the given name exists that contains a different artistId to that which was specified. If this is the case, generates and displays in the view an error message since name must be unique. Otherwise, modifies the object that contains the specified artistId and updates it in the database (the model).
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • deleteArtist

      public void deleteArtist() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Obtains artist object that corresponds to the id provided as a parameter in the request object. If this artist does not exist then an error message is generated and displayed to the user in the view. Otherwise, the album table is checked to observe whether this artist has any albums currently being stored. An artist with albums cannot be deleted as this could entail various runtime errors so an error message is generated and displayed to the user in the view. For any other artist object, the corresponding record is deleted in the database (the model) and the user informed by a message.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException
